meanings.definition: A mythical universal solvent sought in alchemy.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of ancient alchemists searching for azoths to unlock great power.
meanings.sent2: The alchemist believed that the azoths could dissolve any substance.
meanings.sent3: In the story, the wizard mistakenly spilled the azoths, causing a comical chaos.
meanings.sent4: The idea of azoths as a magical elixir captivated the young apprentice's imagination.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious vial contained the legendary azoths, shimmering with untold potential.

meanings.definition: A substance considered to be the ultimate source of all existence.
meanings.sent1: The ancient texts described the azoths as the origin of everything in the universe.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers pondered the concept of azoths as the fundamental building block of reality.
meanings.sent3: The wise sage claimed that laughter was the true azoths of happiness.
meanings.sent4: To the poet, love was the azoths that fueled the flames of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The artist saw nature as the living embodiment of the azoths, constantly renewing and evolving.

meanings.definition: The quintessence or essential element of something.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the hero's courage was the azoths that drove him to face his fears.
meanings.sent2: The chef knew that the secret ingredient was the azoths that made the dish unforgettable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's wit was the azoths that kept the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song captured the azoths of longing and nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The old tree in the garden was said to hold the azoths of wisdom, whispering secrets to those who listened.
